sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: Ximian Red Carpet is a program designed to help you manage the software you have on your computer. It can help you install, update, and remove programs, without making you keep track of dependencies and conflicts yourself. It works with the package management structures your operating systems already has, so you can use it alongside command-line tools without running into conflicts.

note.title: What is a Package?
note.para: Software for most versions of Linux is shipped as a package file, most commonly the rpm or deb format. Each package contains a set of files that constitute the software itself, plus additional information about what the software is, what requirements it has, and where it should be installed. Proper packaging makes software easier to install, upgrade, or remove, and can help manage the interdependencies among various programs.
Ximian Red Carpet supports the rpm (Red Hat Package Manager, used by most distributions) and the deb (Debian) package formats.

sect1.para: Ximian Red Carpet also gives you access to two important services from Ximian, Inc. The first service, Red Carpet Express, is for individuals, and offers access to special high-speed servers with faster connections, so you get better download rates. The other service, Ximian CorporateConnect, is aimed at businesses and workgroups that want to manage software deployment on a relatively large scale.
To find out more about using Red Carpet Express, read . For more about Red Carpet Enterprise visit the Ximian website.

listitem.para: The Ximian Red Carpet update and installation services require a network connection. You can still use Ximian Red Carpet to remove software or install local packages without using a network connection. To install from a file, select File Install Local Packages . For information on removing software, see .
To install, update, or remove software, you must enter your system's root password. If you do not have root privileges, you may only view the software installed on your system.

sect1.para:
A Red Carpet transaction works like this:
Select software you wish to install, update, or remove.
Click the Run button to start the transactions.
Ximian Red Carpet will check to make sure it is possible to perform the requested actions without installing or removing other programs.
If necessary, Ximian Red Carpet will offer to add or remove additional software to satisfy requirements, giving you an opportunity to approve or cancel the actions.
When you approve, click Continue and the actions will be performed.

To start using Ximian Red Carpet, select
SystemSoftware Update from the menu panel, or type red-carpet at the command line.

sect1.title: Channels
sect1.para: Ximian Red Carpet organizes software into channels, groups of software sorted by origin or topic. "Red Hat 8.0," "Ximian Evolution Beta Snapshots," and "Ximian Desktop" are all channels. You can subscribe to different channels based on your interest in them. Software from channels to which you are not subscribed is not updated or installed.

To subscribe to a channel, select EditChannel Subscriptions or press the Channels button in the toolbar. A window will open to show you the list of available channels. Check the box next to a channel to subscribe.

sect1.title: Update
sect1.para: When you start Ximian Red Carpet it will show you a list of software packages that you can update. An update notice is only shown for software that you already have installed, that is in a channel to which you are subscribed, and for which there is a newer version than what you already have. New software, and new versions of software that you have but that is in a channel to which you do not subscribe, is not part of the update screen.
If you do not see any updates, make sure that you are subscribed to the right channels. See to learn how to adjust channel subscriptions.

To perform a simple update of your already installed software:
Select all the items in your update list by clicking on them one by one or choosing Edit Select All.
Mark the packages for installation by clicking the Mark for Installation button.
Click the Run Now button to have Ximian Red Carpet perform the updates.
You may also select individual packages for upgrade.

sect1.title: Install
sect1.para: To install new software, click the FIXME button. This will not display a list of all available software, because that list would be far too long. You must first search for the software you want to see. If you really wish to see every available piece of software, enter a blank search in the search box. It will take a while to display, however.

To search for software, select one or more criteria: type of software, channel, a few letters in the software's name or description, and so forth, and then press the Search button. Each package is displayed with six columns of information:
Action
The action you are performing for this package. This entry will be blank if you have not selected an action for the package. If you have selected an action, it will have an installation or removal icon. You can click on the blank space to perform an action (install a package if it is not installed, remove a packave if it is installed), or click on the icon to cancel the action.
Status
The first column displays the package status. In addition to installed and not installed, package status may be older, meaning that the package displayed here is an older version than one you have installed or newer, meaning that the package here is newer than your version.
Channel
The name of the channel in which this package is shipped.
Lock
The column with the lock icon indicates whether the package is cryptographically signed.
Package
The name of the software package.
Version
The version number of the package.

When you see an item you would like to install, click on it once to select it, then click the Mark For Installation button. The package installation will be added to the list of transactions displayed on the left of the window.
To remove an item from the list of pending transactions, select it and click Cancel or right-click on it and select Cancel.
Proceed to choose other software you would like to install or remove. When you are done choosing software, click the Run Now button in the toolbar at the top of the window.

sect1.title: Remove
sect1.para: To remove software, click the FIXME button. This will display a list of all software installed on your system. You can narrow your list by selecting criteria from the search toolbar.

When you see an item you would like to remove, click on it once to select it, then click the Mark For Removal button. The package removal will be added to the list of transactions displayed on the left of the window.
To remove an item from the list of pending transactions, select it and click Cancel or right-click on it and select Cancel.
Proceed to choose other software you would like to install or remove. When you are done choosing software, click the Run Now button in the toolbar at the top of the window.
